title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 October 2015 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
06:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:03 <Denis> has quit  
06:50 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:09 <cjd> has quit  
08:18 <Ramona> has joined #xwiki  
08:20 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <Ramona> has quit  
09:50 <Ramona> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <cjd> has quit  
10:04 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <cjd> vmassol: friend of mine made an interesting suggestion re translation of objects  
10:42 <cjd> idea is to translate the individual (string) properties but not the whole object  
10:42 <cjd> that way numbers are the same but strings can have different translations (or fallback on the default)  
10:43 <vmassol> numbers shouldn't change anyway  
10:43 <vmassol> there are plenty of ways to implement this indeed  
10:43 <vmassol> would be good to list all ideas on the jira issue so that we have them when we're ready to impelment  
10:45 <cjd> yeah, seems a lot better this way than the "default" method of attaching objects to the translation of the document  
10:46 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <Enygma`> [ANN] Today is BFD#90  
10:57 <vmassol> cjd: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-69#  
11:01 <cjd> ahh no this model has a bug  
11:02 <cjd> if Alice translates a field then Bob changes the value, perhaps we should flush all translations of that property ?  
11:03 <cjd> but if Alice translates a field, perhaps it is her intention to actually change it's value and we should flush the original and hope that somebody can write in the default language  
11:03 <cjd> IMO I'd actually -1 the "fix" on account of this issue  
11:12 <vmassol> cjd: recorded for posterity at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-69?focusedCommentId=88364&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-88364  
11:13 <vmassol> thanks  
11:36 <cjd> Thanks for writing it down  
11:44 <gsmeria> has quit  
12:19 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:34 <gsmeria> ClemensR: Hello! Do you think you have the time to have a look at this: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/MOCCACAL-77? I want to make a release soon enough, but we have this blocker. Thank you!  
13:36 <ClemensR> gsmeria: I had to meet a deadline yesterday and are now catching up on things ... that issue is specific to XWiki 7.2, right?  
13:36 <gsmeria> yep  
13:37 <ClemensR> If you want to make a release, just keep the old dependency to XWiki 6.x ... as I guess the fixes in the release also apply to these xwiki versions ?  
13:38 <ClemensR> or are the other fixes "7.x only", too ?  
13:38 <ClemensR> saying that, I planned to look into that this evening, just have to fix something else before  
13:39 <evalica> ClemensR: I don't think there is anything else 7.x only.  
13:39 <gsmeria> ClemensR: there's just that one  
13:40 <evalica> ClemensR: anwyay - when you have time :) thanks  
13:40 <gsmeria> Thank you, ClemensR!  
13:40 <ClemensR> Ok, then I would propose to proceed with the release when it suits you -and I will try to check the remaining issue asap.  
13:41 <evalica> ClemensR: the release is not urgent. The only thing is that the issue is blocker if you are using 7.2+  
13:41 <evalica> that's why we are asking  
13:41 <evalica> actually…. you cannot create new calendars - in rest you can use the app  
13:42 <evalica> and yes - you will need to see if it's something that can fixed without changing the platform version  
13:43 <ClemensR> actually I planned to update the required dependency to XWiki 7.2 for MoccaCal 2.4 ... for less b/w compat testing. but unless MOCCACAL-77 is fixed, this makes no sense, of course ...  
13:43 <ClemensR> I assume that bug is something that need a version dependent fix, but I am just guessing  
13:44 <evalica> yeah - anyway no sense in releasing now. When you have time to look into the 7.2 bug would be great. Thanls  
13:46 <ClemensR> otoh, if I cannot fix it this week, just go ahead with the release  
13:47 <evalica> k - we'll see  
13:57 <vmassol> yes it's important to keep the dependency on the LTS which is 6.4.x  
13:58 <vmassol> (for extensions)  
13:58 <vmassol> normally Nested Pages shoudn't impact most extensions and if so it's probably easy to fix in a way that also work on 6.4.x  
13:58 <vmassol> I'm interested in knowing what'(s the problem at hand here  
13:58 <vmassol> (in case we've broken something that we shouldn't have in 7.2)  
13:58 <vmassol> (ClemensR)  
13:59 <ClemensR> yes, I am curious, too, just had no time to investigate  
15:01 <cjd> vmassol: we were talking about scope creep, seems I have a slide in my deck which addresses it...  
15:01 <cjd> I forgot about that, "visions scope the problem you want to solve"  
15:02 <vmassol> yeah ok, pretty vague :)  
15:02 <cjd> Well a vision is something like "all the world's information at your fingertips"  
15:02 <cjd> in which case you make a search engine  
15:02 <cjd> and not google docs (not if that's your vision)  
15:03 <vmassol> depends :) you may want to just organize the existing information or contribute to create it  
15:03 <vmassol> I guess if you don't want scope creep then you need a precise vision  
15:03 <vmassol> which is hard  
15:04 <cjd> yup :)  
15:04 <cjd> super hard  
15:05 <vmassol> in any case a single line sentence is not precise neough for sure  
15:05 <vmassol> "the best way to organize information" just scream for scope creep for example :)  
15:05 <vmassol> \*screams  
15:05 <cjd> "the best way to organize your information" is not a vision because it implies comparisons to other options  
15:05 <vmassol> yes that too  
15:05 <cjd> it doesn't describe a world  
15:06 <cjd> "work better together" could be a vision, and if it was then we would probably scrap public website related work  
15:06 <vmassol> yes "best" is subjective  
15:06 <cjd> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XTte01kdG\_k  
15:06 <vmassol> better is also subjective btw  
15:07 <cjd> mmm indeed  
15:07 <vmassol> better = efficient?  
15:07 <vmassol> = in a fun way?  
15:07 <vmassol> etc  
15:07 <cjd> not if you're selecting for 100% employment :D  
15:07 <cjd> Work Better Together, use  Paper(tm)  
15:07 <vmassol> with this motto, I'd develop telepathy  
15:08 <vmassol> :)  
15:08 <cjd> Actually  "make work fun again"  would be a funny slogan  
15:08 <vmassol> (mind to mind communication)  
15:08 <cjd> because it both contains "make work" and an implication that it used to be fun  
15:08 <vmassol> yes a nice one albeit too general, the domain of work is vast  
15:09 <cjd> cjdns vision is routing which isn't so hard to setup, poorly scalable and outdated  
15:09 <vmassol> for me xwiki is "a platform for developing collaborative web applications" which is precise enough but doesn't set limits as what it can do  
15:10 <cjd> Ok then it's not a publishing platform  
15:10 <vmassol> this encompasses content authoring  
15:10 <vmassol> (which is the traditional domain of wikis)  
15:10 <cjd> but like for a personal blog  
15:11 <cjd> non-collaborative  
15:11 <vmassol> and actually with this vision, XE is just an example site  
15:11 <vmassol> similar to JDT (Java Eclipse IDE) which is an example of the Eclipse platform  
15:12 <vmassol> note that I'm talking with my xwiki.org hat here :)  
15:12 <cjd> I think "collaborative web applications" is a little bit skewed from the origin of XWiki, basically  classes, sheets  
15:12 <vmassol> basically the open source projet should focus on the platform aspect  
15:12 <vmassol> making it possible to users and companies to create end products on top of it, with specific scopes  
15:12 <vmassol> xwiki is an application server for me  
15:13 <vmassol> but oriented towards providing services related to collaboration  
15:13 <cjd> Would have to distinguish the vision from that of.. php, ror, etc  
15:13 <vmassol> indeed  
15:13 <vmassol> let me add one keyword  
15:13 <vmassol> "a runtome platform for developing collaborative web applications"  
15:13 <vmassol> \*runtime  
15:13 <msmeria> has quit  
15:14 <vmassol> this is the big difference  
15:14 <vmassol> with ror/php/etc  
15:14 <vmassol> you develop inside a live runtime  
15:14 <cjd> /nod  
15:14 <vmassol> it's about morphing applications  
15:14 <vmassol> I have a slide for this  
15:15 <cjd> a platform for mixing your code with the user's data  
15:15 <cjd> oops nope, that's a bad vision  
15:15 <vmassol> slides 5 and 6 of http://www.slideshare.net/vmassol/xwiki-developing-simple-apps-quickly  
15:16 <vmassol> "a runtime platform for developing simple collaborative web applications quickly"  
15:16 <cjd> yup  
15:16 <cjd> you're drifting into the "idea" space  
15:16 <vmassol> simple and quickly are important too  
15:17 <vmassol> this presnetation summarizes this vision: http://www.slideshare.net/vmassol/xwiki-developing-simple-apps-quickly  
15:17 <cjd> visions are very user centric.  A world where you can affordably get anywhere you want to go with just a phone   --> autonamous car  
15:17 <vmassol> (I've presented it several times already at jugs and it was well accepted)  
15:18 <vmassol> don't know if you had seen it before  
15:18 <cjd> No doubt, Java people will love to see something without the 20 minute compile cycle :P  
15:18 <vmassol> slide 24 shows the pros  
15:19 <cjd> yup  
15:20 <vmassol> however we've never been extra clear on xwiki.org about XE vs the platform. We're presenting XE first since it's more user-focused but it could be an error  
15:22 <cjd> Well the platform approach is \*a\* vision, it might not be the one the users want  
15:23 <cjd> lots of users like the "just works" aspect, even to the point of not bothering to install anything but the .zip and saying "done" (in a small team for instance)  
15:23 <vmassol> indeed we have 2 visions in the project  
15:23 <vmassol> one is enterprise.xwiki.org  
15:23 <vmassol> the other is platform.xwiki.org  
15:24 <vmassol> for platform I think it's pretty well defined with "a runtime platform for developing simple collaborative web applications quickly"  
15:24 <vmassol> now for enterprise, it's not clear to me beyond the "enterprise wiki"  
15:25 <cjd> All of your business information in one place, structured or not.  
15:25 <vmassol> note tthat I didn't mention "wiki" in the platform vision because I feel the common accepted meaning of the word is restrictive for us  
15:25 <vmassol> we've used:  
15:25 <vmassol> second generation wiki  
15:25 <vmassol> enterprise wiki  
15:25 <vmassol> application wiki  
15:26 <vmassol> structured wiki  
15:26 <cjd> IMO don't worry about restrictive words like wiki, it's an excellent word for hinting at what we're about  
15:26 <cjd> bigger risk in explaining correctly what we are and people going  "huh?"  
15:26 <vmassol> "a runtime platform for developing simple collaborative web applications quickly, using the wiki paradigm"  
15:26 <cjd> see also: most of academia  
15:28 <vmassol> this is almost what we say at xwiki.org: "XWiki offers both a generic platform for developing collaborative applications using the wiki paradigm and projects developed on top of it."  
15:28 <cjd> we don't want to be in the thneed business (something "everyone needs" but is not well defined)  
15:28 <vmassol> only problem is that wiki is a connotated word  
15:28 <vmassol> wiki = wikipedia  
15:28 <vmassol> anyway  
15:28 <cjd> it helps a lot  
15:29 <vmassol> not really  
15:29 <vmassol> try explaining xwiki to someone  
15:29 <cjd> people know what wikipedia is even if they would get lost in "structured and unstructured information, linked data, etc"  
15:29 <vmassol> and you say  
15:29 <vmassol> "you know wikipedia?"  
15:29 <cjd> yup :)  
15:29 <vmassol> and then they say "ah yes xwiki is a encyclopedia"  
15:29 <vmassol> \*an  
15:29 <vmassol> :)  
15:30 <cjd> I say:  Have you used wikipedia? -> yes  You know how all of the information is well organized and you can find things? -> yeah  And you know anyone can edit it and every change is logged in a history? -> oh yeah, that's right   Ok, imagine that for organizing the information inside of your business.  
15:31 <vmassol> I do the same but the fact is that it requires explanation  
15:31 <cjd> When people have only a "vague idea" of what is wikipedia, any handle you can grab is going to help  
15:32 <vmassol> if I'm in need of some tool to develop an intranet for example, and I see xwiki == wiki == knowledge base  
15:32 <cjd> If you use only abstract terms, you're going to be there for an hour  
15:32 <vmassol> then I say to myself: ok that's not for me  
15:32 <vmassol> so saying wiki leads to thinking that xwiki is a knowledge base  
15:32 <cjd> It is, among other things  
15:32 <vmassol> sure but then you loose all the people wanting a collaborative intranet  
15:33 <vmassol> (for ex)  
15:33 <cjd> so if you're slick, you say "everything else you can do, that's the X part"  
15:33 <cjd> what's the diff between a collaborative intranet and a knowledge base ?  
15:34 <cjd> social aspect?  
15:35 <vmassol> the domain I think  
15:36 <vmassol> (and the apps ofc)  
15:36 <cjd> Same thing but re-branded ?  
15:38 <ClemensR> knowledge base is where people are looking for information (more readers), collaborative intranet is where they write their wild ideas to and expect others to read it ;)  
15:39 <cjd> ok so neither of those are really a vision, they're ideas  
15:40 <cjd> A vision is "all of the information in your business is at your fingertips"  
15:46 <gsmeria> has quit  
15:48 <OSIMasson> has quit  
15:52 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
16:12 <vmassol> mflorea: how come you're the author of https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/2780a0102e675c36e12d6a08980d7d4b0726d5b4#diff-7bc2a1d22d6526b22159f615775763f3R62 ?  
16:12 <vmassol> I'm the one who applied the translations for 7.3M1 :)  
16:12 <vmassol> it says May 6 so it must be something else  
16:13 <mflorea> it indicates that the commits was included in 7.1M1  
16:14 <vmassol> I see 7.3M1 not 7.1M1  
16:14 <vmassol> ah no  
16:14 <vmassol> my bad  
16:16 <vmassol> mflorea: fyi http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12711 ;)  
16:16 <mflorea> seen it  
16:16 <vmassol> tricky  
16:16 <vmassol> thinking about what we could do...  
16:19 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:25 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
16:44 <evalica> has quit  
16:46 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:53 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <evalica> has quit  
17:17 <gsmeria> has quit  
17:35 <Ramona> has quit  
18:16 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:19 <OSIMasson> has quit  
18:23 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:34 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
18:42 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: hi  
18:42 <vmassol> I think we have a regression on AllDocs  
18:42 <vmassol> seems we cannot filter on the Page column anymore  
18:42 <vmassol> do you think you could check this out?  
18:42 <cjd> has quit  
18:43 <vmassol> (nor the date but maybe we couldn't filter on the date before either)  
18:45 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: the same happens for the children viewer  
18:45 <vmassol> this is an important regression  
18:45 <vmassol> makes the LT almost useless  
18:46 <vmassol> it's probably because of the title issue but in this case we should not display the title for now  
18:50 <ClemensR> has quit  
18:55 <vmassol> gdelhumeau:  
18:55 <vmassol> do we have an issue for this already?  
18:55 <vmassol> note BTW that the location is not consistent with the page since the location doesn't use titles while page does. IMO we shouldn't use any title anywhere ATM  
18:58 <mflorea> has quit  
19:07 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
19:17 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
19:33 <vmassol> has quit  
19:35 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
19:47 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
19:47 <mflorea> has quit  
20:07 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: this is not a regression  
20:07 <gdelhumeau> we \*cannot\* filter on title  
20:07 <gdelhumeau> because some titles are generated by velovity  
20:07 <gdelhumeau> so it's wanted  
20:07 <gdelhumeau> you can filter on location  
20:09 <gdelhumeau> and filtering by location does the same than filerting on name (except that you also get some spaces that match the name too)  
20:12 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
20:15 <gdelhumeau> also displaying the name means, most of the name, displaying 'WebHome'  
20:15 <gdelhumeau> so no, the livetbale is not useless  
20:39 <OSIMasson> has quit  
20:49 <gdelhumeau> I've just fixed the selenium issue  
21:02 <gdelhumeau> add some explanations there: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki73M2#HPageIndex
